abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts substantial. Lessons during preparation
            convey the importance of assessing the country's
            implementation capacity in financial, technical, and legal
            issues, to avoid delays, by establishing a qualified project
            coordination team, and providing technical assistance in
            Bank procedures prior to implementation, in addition to
            developing an initial work program, budget, and a
            procurement plan. Similarly, the establishment of a single
            project coordination unit, particularly in light of multiple
            sources of funding as in this case, should avoid
            overlapping, and increase effectiveness. It is also at the
            early stages of the project, that understanding of the
            assumed decentralization model be made clear, including
            knowledge of the envisaged roles of the different national,
            and provincial authorities, and responsibilities. During
            implementation, lessons once again reinforce the need for
            community participation, and stakeholder involvement,
            because it significantly reduces resistance to change, and
            ensures ownership. Regrettably, the project would have
            greatly improved had a well-designed, and fully operational,
            monitoring and evaluation system been in place as of the
            early stages, providing flexibility to correct course, and,
            as a powerful tool to lay the grounds for discussions on
            policy actions, and investments in education.
